## MATHEMATICS

9709/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 310, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 747, 92]]<|/det|>
Express \(x^{2} - 8x + 11\) in the form \((x + p)^{2} + q\) where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 510, 662, 529]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact solutions of the equation \(x^{2} - 8x + 11 = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 866, 92]]<|/det|>
The thirteenth term of an arithmetic progression is 12 and the sum of the first 30 terms is \(-15\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 541, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the sum of the first 50 terms of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 576, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(a + b = 216\), find the possible values of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 79, 148, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 643, 107]]<|/det|>
Prove the identity \(\frac{\sin^{3}\theta}{\sin\theta - 1} - \frac{\sin^{2}\theta}{1 + \sin\theta} \equiv -\tan^{2}\theta (1 + \sin^{2}\theta).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 85, 670, 260]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 282, 920, 317]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector \(ABC\) of a circle with centre \(A\) and radius \(r\). The line \(BD\) is perpendicular to \(AC\). Angle \(CAB\) is \(\theta\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 331, 146, 349]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 330, 631, 351]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\theta = \frac{1}{6}\pi\), find the exact area of \(BCD\) in terms of \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 332, 920, 350]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 745, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the area of the region enclosed between the curve and the line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 690, 92]]<|/det|>
The curve \(y = \sin x\) is transformed to the curve \(y = 4\sin \left(\frac{1}{2} x - 30^{\circ}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Describe fully a sequence of transformations that have been combined, making clear the order in which the transformations are applied.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 798, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the exact solutions of the equation \(4 \sin \left(\frac{1}{2} x - 30^\circ\right) = 2\sqrt{2}\) for \(0^\circ \leqslant x \leqslant 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 541, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a circle is \(x^{2} + y^{2} + 6x - 2y - 26 = 0.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the centre of the circle and the radius. Hence find the coordinates of the lowest point on the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of the constant \(k\) for which the line with equation \(y = kx - 5\) intersects the circle at two distinct points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 104, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 887, 107]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} = 6x^{2} - \frac{4}{x^{3}}\). The curve has a stationary point at \((-1, \frac{9}{2})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 598, 140]]<|/det|>
Determine the nature of the stationary point at \((-1, \frac{9}{2})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 300, 146, 318]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 300, 403, 318]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 300, 920, 318]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 561, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the curve has no other stationary points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 480, 186, 497]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 479, 920, 515]]<|/det|>
A point \(A\) is moving along the curve and the \(y\)-coordinate of \(A\) is increasing at a rate of 5 units per second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 526, 744, 546]]<|/det|>
Find the rate of increase of the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) at the point where \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 526, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
